Class Election

  • java.lang.Object
    • Election

  • public class Election
extends java.lang.Object
    An Election consists of the candidates running for office, the ballots that have been cast, and the total number of voters. This class implements the ranked choice voting algorithm. Ranked choice voting uses this process:
    1. Rather than vote for a single candidate, a voter ranks all the candidates. For example, if 3 candidates are running on the ballot, a voter identifies their first choice, second choice, and third choice.
    2. The first-choice votes are tallied. If any candidate receives > 50% of the votes, that candidate wins.
    3. If no candidate wins > 50% of the votes, the candidate(s) with the lowest number of votes is(are) eliminated. For each ballot in which an eliminated candidate is the first choice, the 2nd ranked candidate is now the top choice for that ballot.
    4. Steps 2 & 3 are repeated until a candidate wins, or all remaining candidates have exactly the same number of votes. In the case of a tie, there would be a separate election involving just the tied candidates.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Election

        public Election(int numCandidates)
        Create a new Election object. Initially, there are no candidates or votes.
        Parameters:
        numCandidates - the number of candidates in the election.

    • Method Detail

      • addCandidate

        public void addCandidate(java.lang.String name)
        Adds a candidate to the election
        Parameters:
        name - the candidate's name

      • addBallot

        public void addBallot(int[] ranks)
        Adds a completed ballot to the election.
        Parameters:
        ranks - A correctly formulated ballot will have exactly 1 entry with a rank of 1, exactly one entry with a rank of 2, etc. If there are n candidates on the ballot, the values in the rank array passed to the constructor will be some permutation of the numbers 1 to n.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the ballot is not valid.

      • selectWinner

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> selectWinner()
        Apply the ranked choice voting algorithm to identify the winner.
        Returns:
        If there is a winner, this method returns a list containing just the winner's name is returned. If there is a tie, this method returns a list containing the names of the tied candidates.
